afterTHOUGHT is an investment and advisory firm with diverse holdings, including Internet domain names, intellectual property rights, cryptocurrency assets, stocks, and real estate.

DomainTools helps security analysts turn threat data into threat intelligence. We take indicators from your network, including domains and IP's, and connect them with nearly every active domain on the Internet. Those connections inform risk assessments, help profile attackers, guide online fraud investigations, and map cyber activity to attacker infrastructure.Leveraging more than 10 billion related DNS data points to build a map of ‘who’s doing what’ on the Internet, Fortune 100 companies, global government and law enforcement agencies, and leading security solutions providers use the DomainTools platform as a critical ingredient in their threat investigation and mitigation work.

April 30, 2014, Ammar was senior to Hilliary but didn’t manage directly

Ammar has a few things really going for him as a manager: 1. His vision. He has excellent vision and knows his industry extremely well. I'd say during my tenure at TCI we heard from him too little and wished for even more involvement.2. His expanding understanding of tech. Ammar will tell you he's not a tech guy, but he's clearly put his hours in studying. He showed up to many meetings with a clear understanding of the tech and what challenges the team was about to be facing.3. His team oriented mindset. While the team was busting butts and working weekends Ammar showed up in a demonstration of solidarity during those long hours. He didn't need to be there, but he was. A silent partner in the race to achieve the goals.4. He's easy to get along with. He's not the CEO who hides in an office never to be seen. He sits out with the team and participates in the banter, and general office hijinks. All in all working for Ammar even indirectly was a pleasure and I couldn't think more highly of him.

Above and Beyond + Team Player + Operational Excellence = Philip Reynolds.I have had the pleasure of knowing and working with Philip for almost 10 years. I have seen him evolve as an employee, an attorney, a business person, an operational leader, and an individual. Phil's desire to improve his organization and himself is remarkable.The greatest compliment that I can give Phil is to say that I was able to sleep better at night knowing that he was on my team. He is insightful, thoughtful, and driven to produce results. From the finest legal nuances to the highest level corporate strategy, Phil is able to consistently add value.I am sad to see him go, but happy to see him pursuing his dreams.

summary: I’m a serial entrepreneur, investor, adviser, and lifelong learner, currently focused on afterTHOUGHT, an investment and advisory firm with diverse holdings, including Internet domain names, IP rights, cryptocurrency assets, stocks, and real estate. Over the course of my career, I’ve founded or acquired, grown, and exited multiple ventures... and I’m not stopping anytime soon.Word on the street is that I’m an authority on branding, domain name acquisition, development, valuation, and sales. (I’ve been involved in the transaction of some of the Internet's biggest names.)I’m also digging deep into cryptocurrency and blockchain.I’ve been featured in The Wall Street Journal, BusinessWeek, Business 2.0, UCLA Magazine, the DN Journal, and some others.I love cars, watches, fashion, mezcal, and all things bespoke.I have a J.D. from Loyola Law School in Los Angeles, where I was a writer and editor for the school's Law Review Journal, and a B.A. in philosophy from UCLA.
